intro: Tetranthera camphoracea, commonly known as the camphoraceae plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a fragrant, camphor-like scent when crushed. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are accompanied by small, glandular hairs.
